forecast.name: This Afternoon
forecast.detailedForecast: Partly sunny. High near 55, with temperatures falling to around 52 in the afternoon. Northeast wind around 7 mph.

forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.detailedForecast: Rain after 10pm. Mostly cloudy, with a low around 47. Southeast wind around 7 mph. Chance of precipitation is 90%. New rainfall amounts between a tenth and quarter of an inch possible.

weather_report:
The afternoon in Downtown San Francisco unfolds under a tapestry of shifting clouds, a moderate play of sun and shadows painting the landscape in muted tones. As the bright chill of the day begins to yield to evening, temperatures will gradually descend from a high near 55 to a cooler embrace, hovering around 52. The gentle northeast breeze, barely whispering at 7 mph, stirs the air but does little to elevate the day's briskness, prompting a snug draw from light layers.

As night approaches, the forecast hints at rain beginning after ten, cloaking the city in a thick veil of clouds. Expect a notable drop in visibility as the anticipated precipitation rolls in, bringing a 90% chance of rain and suggesting that the marine layer will blanket the Golden Gate and enshroud the neighborhoods. The temperature will sink to around 47, making a warm jacket or a cozy sweater indispensable against the damp chill. Tonight is not a time for grand plans; rather, it invites a retreat indoors, perhaps to an inviting café or a quiet corner of a beloved library, allowing for the gentle patter of rain to accompany your thoughts.
